metadata.Title: CVE-2009-3720 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
The updatePosition function in lib/xmltok_impl.c in libexpat in Expat2.0.1, as used in Python, PyXML, w3c-libwww, and other software, allowscontext-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (applicationcrash) via an XML document with crafted UTF-8 sequences that trigger abuffer over-read, a different vulnerability than CVE-2009-2625.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-3720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.0.1-7ubuntu1
libexpat1 - 2.0.1-7ubuntu1
No subscription required

libxmlrpc-c++8v5 - 1.06.27-1ubuntu7
libxmlrpc-core-c3 - 1.06.27-1ubuntu7
xmlrpc-api-utils - 1.06.27-1ubuntu7
No subscription required

paraview - 3.8.1-1ubuntu1
paraview-python - 3.8.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

xotcl - 1.6.5-1.2
xotcl-shells - 1.6.5-1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.1-7ubuntu1').
xmlrpc-c package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.06.27-1ubuntu7').
paraview package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.1-1ubuntu1').
xotcl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-1.2').
swish-e package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
coin3 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
matanza package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
libxmltok package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
